main-thread-tasks.title: Tasks
main-thread-tasks.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

unminified-css.title: Minify CSS
unminified-css.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-css/).

first-cpu-idle.title: First CPU Idle
first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

unused-javascript.title: Remove unused JavaScript
unused-javascript.description: Remove unused JavaScript to reduce bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/remove-unused-code/).

long-tasks.title: Avoid long main-thread tasks
long-tasks.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn more](https://web.dev/long-tasks-devtools/)

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

uses-long-cache-ttl.title: Serve static assets with an efficient cache policy
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

total-blocking-time.title: Total Blocking Time
total-blocking-time.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

user-timings.title: User Timing marks and measures
user-timings.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

estimated-input-latency.title: Estimated Input Latency
estimated-input-latency.description: Estimated Input Latency is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds, during the busiest 5s window of page load. If your latency is higher than 50 ms, users may perceive your app as laggy. [Learn more](https://web.dev/estimated-input-latency/).

performance-budget.title: Performance budget
performance-budget.description: Keep the quantity and size of network requests under the targets set by the provided performance budget. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

timing-budget.title: Timing budget
timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

max-potential-fid.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
max-potential-fid.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

critical-request-chains.title: Avoid chaining critical requests
critical-request-chains.description: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are loaded with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/critical-request-chains/).

font-display.title: All text remains visible during webfont loads
font-display.description: Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-display/).

render-blocking-resources.title: Eliminate render-blocking resources
render-blocking-resources.description: Resources are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical JS/CSS inline and deferring all non-critical JS/styles. [Learn more](https://web.dev/render-blocking-resources/).

uses-optimized-images.title: Efficiently encode images
uses-optimized-images.description: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

bootup-time.title: JavaScript execution time
bootup-time.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

cumulative-layout-shift.title: Cumulative Layout Shift
cumulative-layout-shift.description: Cumulative Layout Shift measures the movement of visible elements within the viewport. [Learn more](https://web.dev/cls/).

largest-contentful-paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint
largest-contentful-paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

uses-rel-preconnect.title: Preconnect to required origins
uses-rel-preconnect.description: Consider adding `preconnect` or `dns-prefetch` resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/).

server-response-time.title: Initial server response time was short
server-response-time.description: Keep the server response time for the main document short because all other requests depend on it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/time-to-first-byte/).

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

dom-size.title: Avoids an excessive DOM size
dom-size.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

network-server-latency.title: Server Backend Latencies
network-server-latency.description: Server latencies can impact web performance. If the server latency of an origin is high, it's an indication the server is overloaded or has poor backend performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-web-performance/#analyzing-the-resource-waterfall).

uses-responsive-images.title: Properly size images
uses-responsive-images.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

total-byte-weight.title: Avoids enormous network payloads
total-byte-weight.description: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://web.dev/total-byte-weight/).

unused-css-rules.title: Remove unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

layout-shift-elements.title: Avoid large layout shifts
layout-shift-elements.description: These DOM elements contribute most to the CLS of the page.

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

speed-index.title: Speed Index
speed-index.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/speed-index/).

uses-rel-preload.title: Preload key requests
uses-rel-preload.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

uses-text-compression.title: Enable text compression
uses-text-compression.description: Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-text-compression/).

largest-contentful-paint-element.title: Largest Contentful Paint element
largest-contentful-paint-element.description: This is the largest contentful element painted within the viewport. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

bootup-time.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

uses-rel-preload.title: Preload key requests
uses-rel-preload.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

total-byte-weight.title: Avoids enormous network payloads
total-byte-weight.description: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://web.dev/total-byte-weight/).

uses-responsive-images.title: Properly size images
uses-responsive-images.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

first-meaningful-paint.title: First Meaningful Paint
first-meaningful-paint.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

max-potential-fid.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
max-potential-fid.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

total-blocking-time.title: Total Blocking Time
total-blocking-time.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).

critical-request-chains.title: Avoid chaining critical requests
critical-request-chains.description: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are loaded with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/critical-request-chains/).

unminified-javascript.title: Minify JavaScript
unminified-javascript.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-javascript/).

timing-budget.title: Timing budget
timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

long-tasks.title: Avoid long main-thread tasks
long-tasks.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn more](https://web.dev/long-tasks-devtools/)

network-requests.title: Network Requests
network-requests.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

third-party-summary.title: Minimize third-party usage
third-party-summary.description: Third-party code can significantly impact load performance. Limit the number of redundant third-party providers and try to load third-party code after your page has primarily finished loading. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/loading-third-party-javascript/).
third-party-summary.displayValue: Third-party code blocked the main thread for 0 ms

main-thread-tasks.title: Tasks
main-thread-tasks.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

speed-index.title: Speed Index
speed-index.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/speed-index/).

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

first-contentful-paint.title: First Contentful Paint
first-contentful-paint.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-contentful-paint/).

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

uses-optimized-images.title: Efficiently encode images
uses-optimized-images.description: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

uses-rel-preconnect.title: Preconnect to required origins
uses-rel-preconnect.description: Consider adding `preconnect` or `dns-prefetch` resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/).

first-meaningful-paint.title: First Meaningful Paint
first-meaningful-paint.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

performance-budget.title: Performance budget
performance-budget.description: Keep the quantity and size of network requests under the targets set by the provided performance budget. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

user-timings.title: User Timing marks and measures
user-timings.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

network-rtt.title: Network Round Trip Times
network-rtt.description: Network round trip times (RTT) have a large impact on performance. If the RTT to an origin is high, it's an indication that servers closer to the user could improve performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-latency-and-bandwidth/).

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

uses-long-cache-ttl.title: Serve static assets with an efficient cache policy
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

server-response-time.title: Initial server response time was short
server-response-time.description: Keep the server response time for the main document short because all other requests depend on it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/time-to-first-byte/).

unminified-javascript.title: Minify JavaScript
unminified-javascript.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-javascript/).

first-cpu-idle.title: First CPU Idle
first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

unused-javascript.title: Remove unused JavaScript
unused-javascript.description: Remove unused JavaScript to reduce bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/remove-unused-code/).

render-blocking-resources.title: Eliminate render-blocking resources
render-blocking-resources.description: Resources are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical JS/CSS inline and deferring all non-critical JS/styles. [Learn more](https://web.dev/render-blocking-resources/).

dom-size.title: Avoids an excessive DOM size
dom-size.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

estimated-input-latency.title: Estimated Input Latency
estimated-input-latency.description: Estimated Input Latency is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds, during the busiest 5s window of page load. If your latency is higher than 50 ms, users may perceive your app as laggy. [Learn more](https://web.dev/estimated-input-latency/).

main-thread-tasks.title: Tasks
main-thread-tasks.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

first-contentful-paint.title: First Contentful Paint
first-contentful-paint.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-contentful-paint/).

uses-rel-preload.title: Preload key requests
uses-rel-preload.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

largest-contentful-paint-element.title: Largest Contentful Paint element
largest-contentful-paint-element.description: This is the largest contentful element painted within the viewport. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

total-blocking-time.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).

timing-budget.title: Timing budget
timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

largest-contentful-paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint
largest-contentful-paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

unused-css-rules.title: Remove unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

network-requests.title: Network Requests
network-requests.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

font-display.title: All text remains visible during webfont loads
font-display.description: Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-display/).

uses-optimized-images.title: Efficiently encode images
uses-optimized-images.description: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

bootup-time.title: JavaScript execution time
bootup-time.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

layout-shift-elements.title: Avoid large layout shifts
layout-shift-elements.description: These DOM elements contribute most to the CLS of the page.

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

third-party-summary.title: Minimize third-party usage
third-party-summary.description: Third-party code can significantly impact load performance. Limit the number of redundant third-party providers and try to load third-party code after your page has primarily finished loading. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/loading-third-party-javascript/).
third-party-summary.displayValue: Third-party code blocked the main thread for 0 ms

uses-rel-preload.title: Preload key requests
uses-rel-preload.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

user-timings.title: User Timing marks and measures
user-timings.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

network-requests.title: Network Requests
network-requests.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

unused-css-rules.title: Remove unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

speed-index.title: Speed Index
speed-index.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/speed-index/).

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

long-tasks.title: Avoid long main-thread tasks
long-tasks.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn more](https://web.dev/long-tasks-devtools/)

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

font-display.title: All text remains visible during webfont loads
font-display.description: Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-display/).

unminified-javascript.title: Minify JavaScript
unminified-javascript.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-javascript/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

total-blocking-time.title: Total Blocking Time
total-blocking-time.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).

uses-long-cache-ttl.title: Serve static assets with an efficient cache policy
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

dom-size.title: Avoids an excessive DOM size
dom-size.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

timing-budget.title: Timing budget
timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

network-server-latency.title: Server Backend Latencies
network-server-latency.description: Server latencies can impact web performance. If the server latency of an origin is high, it's an indication the server is overloaded or has poor backend performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-web-performance/#analyzing-the-resource-waterfall).

server-response-time.title: Initial server response time was short
server-response-time.description: Keep the server response time for the main document short because all other requests depend on it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/time-to-first-byte/).

uses-rel-preconnect.title: Preconnect to required origins
uses-rel-preconnect.description: Consider adding `preconnect` or `dns-prefetch` resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/).

uses-responsive-images.title: Properly size images
uses-responsive-images.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

layout-shift-elements.title: Avoid large layout shifts
layout-shift-elements.description: These DOM elements contribute most to the CLS of the page.

largest-contentful-paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint
largest-contentful-paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

network-rtt.title: Network Round Trip Times
network-rtt.description: Network round trip times (RTT) have a large impact on performance. If the RTT to an origin is high, it's an indication that servers closer to the user could improve performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-latency-and-bandwidth/).

unminified-css.title: Minify CSS
unminified-css.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-css/).

main-thread-tasks.title: Tasks
main-thread-tasks.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

first-meaningful-paint.title: First Meaningful Paint
first-meaningful-paint.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

critical-request-chains.title: Avoid chaining critical requests
critical-request-chains.description: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are loaded with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/critical-request-chains/).

cumulative-layout-shift.title: Cumulative Layout Shift
cumulative-layout-shift.description: Cumulative Layout Shift measures the movement of visible elements within the viewport. [Learn more](https://web.dev/cls/).

unused-javascript.title: Remove unused JavaScript
unused-javascript.description: Remove unused JavaScript to reduce bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/remove-unused-code/).

first-cpu-idle.title: First CPU Idle
first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

uses-optimized-images.title: Efficiently encode images
uses-optimized-images.description: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

total-byte-weight.title: Avoids enormous network payloads
total-byte-weight.description: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://web.dev/total-byte-weight/).

max-potential-fid.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
max-potential-fid.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

largest-contentful-paint-element.title: Largest Contentful Paint element
largest-contentful-paint-element.description: This is the largest contentful element painted within the viewport. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

estimated-input-latency.description: Estimated Input Latency is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds, during the busiest 5s window of page load. bootup-time.title: JavaScript execution time
bootup-time.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

uses-text-compression.title: Enable text compression
uses-text-compression.description: Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-text-compression/).

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

first-cpu-idle.title: First CPU Idle
first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

unminified-javascript.title: Minify JavaScript
unminified-javascript.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-javascript/).

max-potential-fid.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
max-potential-fid.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

dom-size.title: Avoids an excessive DOM size
dom-size.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

largest-contentful-paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint
largest-contentful-paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

largest-contentful-paint-element.title: Largest Contentful Paint element
largest-contentful-paint-element.description: This is the largest contentful element painted within the viewport. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

estimated-input-latency.title: Estimated Input Latency
estimated-input-latency.description: Estimated Input Latency is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds, during the busiest 5s window of page load. If your latency is higher than 50 ms, users may perceive your app as laggy. [Learn more](https://web.dev/estimated-input-latency/).

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

third-party-summary.title: Minimize third-party usage
third-party-summary.description: Third-party code can significantly impact load performance. Limit the number of redundant third-party providers and try to load third-party code after your page has primarily finished loading. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/loading-third-party-javascript/).
third-party-summary.displayValue: Third-party code blocked the main thread for 0 ms

network-requests.title: Network Requests
network-requests.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

unused-css-rules.title: Remove unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

speed-index.title: Speed Index
speed-index.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/speed-index/).

unminified-css.title: Minify CSS
unminified-css.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-css/).

uses-text-compression.title: Enable text compression
uses-text-compression.description: Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-text-compression/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

cumulative-layout-shift.title: Cumulative Layout Shift
cumulative-layout-shift.description: Cumulative Layout Shift measures the movement of visible elements within the viewport. [Learn more](https://web.dev/cls/).

total-byte-weight.title: Avoids enormous network payloads
total-byte-weight.description: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://web.dev/total-byte-weight/).

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

server-response-time.title: Initial server response time was short
server-response-time.description: Keep the server response time for the main document short because all other requests depend on it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/time-to-first-byte/).

main-thread-tasks.title: Tasks
main-thread-tasks.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

uses-rel-preload.title: Preload key requests
uses-rel-preload.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

first-cpu-idle.title: First CPU Idle
first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

long-tasks.title: Avoid long main-thread tasks
long-tasks.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn more](https://web.dev/long-tasks-devtools/)

uses-rel-preconnect.title: Preconnect to required origins
uses-rel-preconnect.description: Consider adding `preconnect` or `dns-prefetch` resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

unused-css-rules.title: Remove unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

server-response-time.title: Initial server response time was short
server-response-time.description: Keep the server response time for the main document short because all other requests depend on it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/time-to-first-byte/).

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

user-timings.title: User Timing marks and measures
user-timings.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

unused-javascript.title: Remove unused JavaScript
unused-javascript.description: Remove unused JavaScript to reduce bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/remove-unused-code/).

critical-request-chains.title: Avoid chaining critical requests
critical-request-chains.description: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are loaded with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/critical-request-chains/).

first-meaningful-paint.title: First Meaningful Paint
first-meaningful-paint.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

dom-size.title: Avoids an excessive DOM size
dom-size.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

speed-index.title: Speed Index
speed-index.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/speed-index/).

network-server-latency.title: Server Backend Latencies
network-server-latency.description: Server latencies can impact web performance. If the server latency of an origin is high, it's an indication the server is overloaded or has poor backend performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-web-performance/#analyzing-the-resource-waterfall).

uses-responsive-images.title: Properly size images
uses-responsive-images.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

first-contentful-paint.title: First Contentful Paint
first-contentful-paint.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-contentful-paint/).

cumulative-layout-shift.title: Cumulative Layout Shift
cumulative-layout-shift.description: Cumulative Layout Shift measures the movement of visible elements within the viewport. [Learn more](https://web.dev/cls/).

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

layout-shift-elements.title: Avoid large layout shifts
layout-shift-elements.description: These DOM elements contribute most to the CLS of the page.

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

network-rtt.title: Network Round Trip Times
network-rtt.description: Network round trip times (RTT) have a large impact on performance. If the RTT to an origin is high, it's an indication that servers closer to the user could improve performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-latency-and-bandwidth/).

performance-budget.title: Performance budget
performance-budget.description: Keep the quantity and size of network requests under the targets set by the provided performance budget. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

unminified-javascript.title: Minify JavaScript
unminified-javascript.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-javascript/).

uses-long-cache-ttl.title: Serve static assets with an efficient cache policy
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

unminified-css.title: Minify CSS
unminified-css.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-css/).

render-blocking-resources.title: Eliminate render-blocking resources
render-blocking-resources.description: Resources are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical JS/CSS inline and deferring all non-critical JS/styles. [Learn more](https://web.dev/render-blocking-resources/).

bootup-time.title: JavaScript execution time
bootup-time.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

timing-budget.title: Timing budget
timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

total-blocking-time.title: Total Blocking Time
total-blocking-time.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).

largest-contentful-paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint
largest-contentful-paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

font-display.title: All text remains visible during webfont loads
font-display.description: Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-display/).

uses-rel-preload.title: Preload key requests
uses-rel-preload.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

bootup-time.title: JavaScript execution time
bootup-time.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

unminified-javascript.title: Minify JavaScript
unminified-javascript.description: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-javascript/).

total-blocking-time.title: Total Blocking Time
total-blocking-time.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

uses-responsive-images.title: Properly size images
uses-responsive-images.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

server-response-time.title: Initial server response time was short
server-response-time.description: Keep the server response time for the main document short because all other requests depend on it. [Learn more](https://web.dev/time-to-first-byte/).

first-cpu-idle.title: First CPU Idle
first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

dom-size.title: Avoids an excessive DOM size
dom-size.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

first-contentful-paint.title: First Contentful Paint
first-contentful-paint.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-contentful-paint/).

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

cumulative-layout-shift.title: Cumulative Layout Shift
cumulative-layout-shift.description: Cumulative Layout Shift measures the movement of visible elements within the viewport. [Learn more](https://web.dev/cls/).

uses-optimized-images.title: Efficiently encode images
uses-optimized-images.description: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

font-display.title: All text remains visible during webfont loads
font-display.description: Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-display/).

largest-contentful-paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint
largest-contentful-paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

unminified-css.title: Minify CSS
unminified-css.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-css/).

network-requests.title: Network Requests
network-requests.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

user-timings.title: User Timing marks and measures
user-timings.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

main-thread-tasks.title: Tasks
main-thread-tasks.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

max-potential-fid.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
max-potential-fid.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

uses-long-cache-ttl.title: Serve static assets with an efficient cache policy
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

render-blocking-resources.title: Eliminate render-blocking resources
render-blocking-resources.description: Resources are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical JS/CSS inline and deferring all non-critical JS/styles. [Learn more](https://web.dev/render-blocking-resources/).

first-meaningful-paint.title: First Meaningful Paint
first-meaningful-paint.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

unused-javascript.title: Remove unused JavaScript
unused-javascript.description: Remove unused JavaScript to reduce bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/remove-unused-code/).

network-server-latency.title: Server Backend Latencies
network-server-latency.description: Server latencies can impact web performance. If the server latency of an origin is high, it's an indication the server is overloaded or has poor backend performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-web-performance/#analyzing-the-resource-waterfall).

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

speed-index.title: Speed Index
speed-index.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/speed-index/).

total-byte-weight.title: Avoids enormous network payloads
total-byte-weight.description: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://web.dev/total-byte-weight/).

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

critical-request-chains.title: Avoid chaining critical requests
critical-request-chains.description: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are loaded with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/critical-request-chains/).

largest-contentful-paint-element.title: Largest Contentful Paint element
largest-contentful-paint-element.description: This is the largest contentful element painted within the viewport. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

third-party-summary.title: Minimize third-party usage
third-party-summary.description: Third-party code can significantly impact load performance. Limit the number of redundant third-party providers and try to load third-party code after your page has primarily finished loading. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/loading-third-party-javascript/).
third-party-summary.displayValue: Third-party code blocked the main thread for 0 ms

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

estimated-input-latency.title: Estimated Input Latency
estimated-input-latency.description: Estimated Input Latency is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds, during the busiest 5s window of page load. If your latency is higher than 50 ms, users may perceive your app as laggy. [Learn more](https://web.dev/estimated-input-latency/).

long-tasks.title: Avoid long main-thread tasks
long-tasks.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn more](https://web.dev/long-tasks-devtools/)

uses-text-compression.title: Enable text compression
uses-text-compression.description: Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-text-compression/).

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

timing-budget.title: Timing budget
timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

uses-rel-preconnect.title: Preconnect to required origins
uses-rel-preconnect.description: Consider adding `preconnect` or `dns-prefetch` resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/).

performance-budget.title: Performance budget
performance-budget.description: Keep the quantity and size of network requests under the targets set by the provided performance budget. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

network-rtt.title: Network Round Trip Times
network-rtt.description: Network round trip times (RTT) have a large impact on performance. If the RTT to an origin is high, it's an indication that servers closer to the user could improve performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-latency-and-bandwidth/).

unused-css-rules.title: Remove unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

user-timings.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

uses-responsive-images.title: Properly size images
uses-responsive-images.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

first-meaningful-paint.title: First Meaningful Paint
first-meaningful-paint.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

first-cpu-idle.title: First CPU Idle
first-cpu-idle.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.  [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-cpu-idle/).

network-requests.title: Network Requests
network-requests.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

uses-optimized-images.title: Efficiently encode images
uses-optimized-images.description: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

main-thread-tasks.title: Tasks
main-thread-tasks.description: Lists the toplevel main thread tasks that executed during page load.

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

performance-budget.title: Performance budget
performance-budget.description: Keep the quantity and size of network requests under the targets set by the provided performance budget. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

first-contentful-paint.title: First Contentful Paint
first-contentful-paint.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-contentful-paint/).

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

unminified-css.title: Minify CSS
unminified-css.description: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unminified-css/).

third-party-summary.title: Minimize third-party usage
third-party-summary.description: Third-party code can significantly impact load performance. Limit the number of redundant third-party providers and try to load third-party code after your page has primarily finished loading. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/loading-third-party-javascript/).
third-party-summary.displayValue: Third-party code blocked the main thread for 0 ms

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

max-potential-fid.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
max-potential-fid.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

render-blocking-resources.title: Eliminate render-blocking resources
render-blocking-resources.description: Resources are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical JS/CSS inline and deferring all non-critical JS/styles. [Learn more](https://web.dev/render-blocking-resources/).

timing-budget.title: Timing budget
timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

uses-text-compression.title: Enable text compression
uses-text-compression.description: Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-text-compression/).

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

uses-long-cache-ttl.title: Serve static assets with an efficient cache policy
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

uses-responsive-images.title: Properly size images
uses-responsive-images.description: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-responsive-images/).

cumulative-layout-shift.title: Cumulative Layout Shift
cumulative-layout-shift.description: Cumulative Layout Shift measures the movement of visible elements within the viewport. [Learn more](https://web.dev/cls/).

resource-summary.title: Keep request counts low and transfer sizes small
resource-summary.description: To set budgets for the quantity and size of page resources, add a budget.json file. [Learn more](https://web.dev/use-lighthouse-for-performance-budgets/).

uses-rel-preconnect.title: Preconnect to required origins
uses-rel-preconnect.description: Consider adding `preconnect` or `dns-prefetch` resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preconnect/).

performance-budget.title: Performance budget
performance-budget.description: Keep the quantity and size of network requests under the targets set by the provided performance budget. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

largest-contentful-paint-element.title: Largest Contentful Paint element
largest-contentful-paint-element.description: This is the largest contentful element painted within the viewport. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

unused-css-rules.title: Remove unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove dead rules from stylesheets and defer the loading of CSS not used for above-the-fold content to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/unused-css-rules/).

network-server-latency.title: Server Backend Latencies
network-server-latency.description: Server latencies can impact web performance. If the server latency of an origin is high, it's an indication the server is overloaded or has poor backend performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-web-performance/#analyzing-the-resource-waterfall).

uses-passive-event-listeners.title: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-passive-event-listeners/).

uses-text-compression.title: Enable text compression
uses-text-compression.description: Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-text-compression/).

font-display.title: All text remains visible during webfont loads
font-display.description: Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading. [Learn more](https://web.dev/font-display/).

uses-webp-images.title: Serve images in next-gen formats
uses-webp-images.description: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-webp-images/).

total-byte-weight.title: Avoids enormous network payloads
total-byte-weight.description: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://web.dev/total-byte-weight/).

dom-size.title: Avoids an excessive DOM size
dom-size.description: A large DOM will increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://web.dev/dom-size/).

network-rtt.title: Network Round Trip Times
network-rtt.description: Network round trip times (RTT) have a large impact on performance. If the RTT to an origin is high, it's an indication that servers closer to the user could improve performance. [Learn more](https://hpbn.co/primer-on-latency-and-bandwidth/).

third-party-summary.title: Minimize third-party usage
third-party-summary.description: Third-party code can significantly impact load performance. Limit the number of redundant third-party providers and try to load third-party code after your page has primarily finished loading. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/loading-third-party-javascript/).
third-party-summary.displayValue: Third-party code blocked the main thread for 0 ms

efficient-animated-content.title: Use video formats for animated content
efficient-animated-content.description: Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images instead of GIF to save network bytes. [Learn more](https://web.dev/efficient-animated-content/)

layout-shift-elements.title: Avoid large layout shifts
layout-shift-elements.description: These DOM elements contribute most to the CLS of the page.

uses-optimized-images.title: Efficiently encode images

max-potential-fid.title: Max Potential First Input Delay
max-potential-fid.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).

redirects.title: Avoid multiple page redirects
redirects.description: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://web.dev/redirects/).

first-meaningful-paint.title: First Meaningful Paint
first-meaningful-paint.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-meaningful-paint/).

mainthread-work-breakdown.title: Minimizes main-thread work
mainthread-work-breakdown.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/mainthread-work-breakdown/)

offscreen-images.title: Defer offscreen images
offscreen-images.description: Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

uses-rel-preload.title: Preload key requests
uses-rel-preload.description: Consider using `<link rel=preload>` to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-rel-preload/).

critical-request-chains.title: Avoid chaining critical requests
critical-request-chains.description: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are loaded with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://web.dev/critical-request-chains/).

long-tasks.title: Avoid long main-thread tasks
long-tasks.description: Lists the longest tasks on the main thread, useful for identifying worst contributors to input delay. [Learn more](https://web.dev/long-tasks-devtools/)

total-blocking-time.title: Total Blocking Time
total-blocking-time.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).

network-requests.title: Network Requests
network-requests.description: Lists the network requests that were made during page load.

largest-contentful-paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint
largest-contentful-paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn More](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)

unused-javascript.title: Remove unused JavaScript
unused-javascript.description: Remove unused JavaScript to reduce bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://web.dev/remove-unused-code/).

bootup-time.title: JavaScript execution time
bootup-time.description: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling, and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this. [Learn more](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

no-document-write.title: Avoids `document.write()`
no-document-write.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/no-document-write/).

interactive.title: Time to Interactive
interactive.description: Time to interactive is the amount of time it takes for the page to become fully interactive. [Learn more](https://web.dev/interactive/).

first-contentful-paint.title: First Contentful Paint
first-contentful-paint.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://web.dev/first-contentful-paint/).

user-timings.title: User Timing marks and measures
user-timings.description: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to measure your app's real-world performance during key user experiences. [Learn more](https://web.dev/user-timings/).

timing-budget.description: Set a timing budget to help you keep an eye on the performance of your site. Performant sites load fast and respond to user input events quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/budgets).

uses-long-cache-ttl.title: Serve static assets with an efficient cache policy
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://web.dev/uses-long-cache-ttl/).

estimated-input-latency.title: Estimated Input Latency
estimated-input-latency.description: Estimated Input Latency is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds, during the busiest 5s window of page load.
